result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon T Lawson

records.addlTxt: 9:00 am.  Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  No appearance by the defendant or surety.  Victim notification complied with.  State advised the court that no recompense has been requested.  Requested that cash bond be forfeited.  Court found that notice has been properly made, victim notification has been complied with, no appearance by the defendant or surety.  Bond ordered forfeited pursuant to 969.13 Wis. Stat.  Case still in warrant status.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: BBH scheduled to quash warrant at request of Atty Hammer

Attorney Russ Hammer is by phone without defendant present.  ADA Melissa Inlow is present for the State.  Attorney Hammer does not know why his client isn't here.  Court notes he has had FTA's in the past on this case.  Hammer states he discharged from probation recently.  Court authorizes a warrant and removes from trial calendar in October.

Called SPDO and they will lett SPD Hammer know he needs to opt into the case.
